p:
In the absence of mutation, an identity matrix, the basic reproduction number is
where is the strain reproduction number and . A competitive exclusion result applies to this model, similar to the result for multiple pathogens (see ( 10)). If and , then strain 1, the virus with the greatest strain reproduction number outcompetes all other virus strains and persists ( De Leenheer and Pilyugin [2008]). If all strain reproduction numbers are less than one, that is, if , then all strains die out. With mutation, , and , more than one strain persists ( De Leenheer and Pilyugin [2008]).
